data.title: Dinner
data.text: This place was excellent. Don't let the ala carte servings scare you. It was plenty of food. I ordered WAY too much. The waitress was very helpful in suggesting food.  Can't wait to go back again soon. A little pricey however but we'll worth it.

data.title: The Bizarra Capital Experience
data.text: Bizarra Capital is another restaurant run by Richard Diaz.  It is the second restaurant we have dined in and it was fabulous. the service was friendly and prompt. The food was great!  We had the bacon wrapped shrimp. The shrimp was cooked to perfection and the bacon was also done perfectly and was not greasy. The best item we ate was the Pato Taco, duck taco.  It is hard to describe its taste but it left us wanting more.  We will return to the restaurant soon. We will also see what other restaurant Mr. Diaz owns and we will try them.

data.title: Perfect Mexican real food
data.text:
wonderfull food, real Mexican   waiter is very friendly 
maravilloso, maravilloso, maravilloso
maravilloso, maravilloso, maravilloso

data.title: Authentic Mexican food with a creative flair.
data.text: The food is excellent. So many dishes and small plates that I have a hard time choosing. Very good beer and mixed drink selection. Servers are always pleasant and helpful. What real Mexican food should taste like.

data.title: Creative Adventurous Menu
data.text: What a delightful addition to Whittier's Uptown dining options! Bizarra Capital offers menu items that are not your typical Mexican/Latin fare.  From delicately flavored soups changing daily to spicy tacos there is something for everyone. The guacamole is simply wonderful. The restaurant's interior is classy - and don't forget to read the walls in the restrooms! We have dined here at lunch for business meetings as well as casual meals and are always pleased with the service as well as the food.

data.title: Tacos!!
data.text: We decided to try this place out as its been here awhile and we always wondered. They seemed a little short staffed but they also had a large party not an every day occurrence. Service was friendly though and they gave us little soup starters. Food was fresh and flavorful.  Would come again for sure.

data.title: aLways good and fresh!
data.text: This is just a great little Mexican restaurant.  The food is tasty and always fresh.  The bacon wrapped shrimp are to die for and the steak tacos are just plain yummy.  My most recent visit here included my 5 grandkids and the service was fast and very accommodating!

data.title: In and Out in 20 minutes!
data.text: After bring recommended this place it was a bit disappointing to discover that there were no more drinks bring served after 10pm, which by UK standards is unsatisfactory. The food was average although the shrimp tacos and the flank steak were definitely better than average. We had a slight hiccup with the wine we ordered but our waiter solved this with great customer service and a smile! It certainly was the quickest dinner I have ever had!

data.title: A great taco place in Whittier
data.text: Have been here several times for lunch. Service speed can be hit or miss. But each time the staff was friendly. Their tacos are flavorful but on the pricier side. Tuesdays is the day to go for special taco price. Had the chorizo and asada. I liked the chorizo best. The guacamole appetizer was simple but tasty.  Plenty of good Mexican places in the LA area, but if you're near Whittier this place may be worth a visit.

data.title: Mexican food with a twist, yummy!
data.text: Love the food, delicious, affordable, with twist on what we experience as Mexican food.  Flavors are wonderful, best mole ever, love potatoes,cheese tacos, plenty of beer, full bar, and and now more wine.

data.title: Nice Whittier Eatery
data.text: My wife and I love the relaxed atmosphere and the wonderful food.  Such a great spot for food and drinks.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: I enjoyed this place. The food was excellent. It was a bit expensive but I guess the quality of the food made up for the expense. I would go there again. I would think this would be the best place in Whittier to get quality Mexican food.

data.title: Good Golly Miss Maria...
data.text:
Wow. This place is amazing! Has to be some of, if not the best, Mexican food I've ever had!!

Located in a nice residential area of Whittier, this quaint little restaurant offers much more than meets the eye when you first look at the unassuming building. The phrase "walk quietly and carry a big stick" comes to mind. Nothing pretentious -- just all around amazing food. 

It's nicely decorated and cozy and seems like a perfect spot for a date night if you're looking for some really amazing food and not wanting to take a second mortgage out on your house to pay for it. 

In case you couldn't tell, I'm white -- a classic gringo, if you will. Because of that, and the fact I don't speak Spanish, I don't remember the official names and titles of all we ate, so I'll off their descriptions and let you take it from there. 

First we started with drinks (of course). I ordered a classic margarita and my coworker ordered the equivalent of a mojito but made with tequila instead of rum. Both solid choices. $10 for a cocktail is a bit much, but it is what it is. There was a small little alcove when you first walk in where the bar is located and the drink menu had some pretty innovative cocktails -- much more than just shots of tequila, watered down margaritas, and bottles Mexican beer you get in most places. 

For an appetizer we ordered this dish that was basically zucchini squash made with corn and red bell peppers cooked in butter and topped with a flavored aioli sauce. It was insanely delicious!!!!

For the entrees, my coworker ordered some dish with octopus in it ($15). I'm a Midwest meat and potatoes kind of guy, so I avoided that like it was some creepy crawly ink-shooting creature from the ocean. Oh wait, that's exactly what it is. 

I ordered three fish tacos ($4 each). I can't remember what fish they used, but it was a good kind (wahoo?), not cheap white fish or something like that. I also ordered a side of frijoles charros (I can't believe I remembered that) -- pinto beans with bacon ($4). 

My meal was absolutely amazing. One of the best fish tacos I've ever had in my life (short from a little hole in the wall Mexican restaurant on Vashon Island, Washington but it gives these guys something to aspire to). The beans were incredible and my coworker (a well versed and experienced foodie of Mexican culture who says this is hands down his favorite Mexican restaurant in the world -- the ceviche is supposedly worth dying for, by the way) even convinced me to try the octopus. It was a little fishy and not my typical style, but I was amazed at how soft and tender it was. 

Overall, this place is amazing. The only reason they get 4 stars instead of 5 is because our server (a nice young kid and a dead ringer for Joseph Gordon-Levitt's younger brother) seemed to forget we were there on more than one occasion. We had to ask for drinks multiple times and each time he came out of the back to check his tables, he just looked around the room at them -- while looking right past us waving our hands and trying to et his attention -- and then went into the back again. Oh well, it's probably for the best. We only had 3 drinks each, and if he'd answered every time we tried to flag him down, it would've likely been twice that much...

data.title: Not your usual Mexican restaurant
data.text: If you're looking for authentic Mexican food, this is the place to go.  We dine there on a regular basis and we their tacos and the carne asada are our favorites.  Their margarita is one of the best I've had and their agua fresca is always fresh.  Their guacamole is divine!  The service is always friendly and I like it that some of the staff recognize us as regulars.

data.title: Great Food, slow service, mixed feelings.
data.text: I have been to this place a total of 4 times. Once for lunch, great food, great service. Could it be repeated? NO!  Second time took my husband there for dinner, Great food, slow service. Third time took my husband and a friend telling them how great the food was, great food, slow service. Fourth time, took my husband and 3 friends telling how great the food was and so so on the service hoping for a better time. Well, we order, the beers took sometime to get to us, the food came, 2 orders of the black beans, both lukewarm as was the rice, and both of the Chili Colorado's. We ordered more beers they also took time to come out, are server was had to find, he did take the food back to warm up, the beans were good, the rice so so, the Chili Colorado was not warmed enough. Never saw a manager or anyone in charge to say how sorry they were since there was so much that need to go back. The server said sorry but his service wasn't all that great. I know we will be back since the food is good, Hopefully the service improves. Give it a try, just don't be in a hurry.

data.title: Best tacos
data.text: This place is a true gem,  The food is incredible, very fresh and full of flavor.  We have eaten here several times and each time the food if great.  Favorites are the chicken tacos and the shrimp tacos.   The recently added mixed drinks to their menu in addition to craft beer.  The only draw back is on Friday they have live mariachi bands and while they are very good, it is way too loud so difficult to hear or speak to anyone at your table.

data.title: Lunch and Dinner
data.text: Chef prepares Zacatecas (State) , Mexico Style Cuisine. Not your ordinary Mexican Dishes. In Uptown Old Whittier; years ago the building was a Sizzlers; not impressive looking but - friendly and good service. Muy simpaticos! Visited 4 times - 1 Dinner, 1 Lunch, 2 Sunday Brunch. (:>}) - Chuck

data.title: Lacks luster
data.text: Service was average. Food was average. Some specialty dishes that are unique. Atmosphere is non impressive.

data.title: Not what I expected
data.text:
i was very surprised that they do not offer coffee refills, you have to pay for seconds.
I asked them from which Mexican State the food was and they answer from everywhere.
it was osme type of food I never tasted in my life

data.title: What a surprise!
data.text:
We usually steer clear of "Mexican" restaurants because it's always the same....it's flour or corn tortilla, with your choice of fillings and the usual beans/rice...blah, blah..
This place doesn't serve blah blah! 
Wowed away by the "maded when ordered" guacamole and house made chips...and not ordinary salsa-excellent margaritas, not overly sweet. I ordered the mole chicken tacos, which I believe was considered a "large plate", but they also offer small plates-serving size. 
The wait staff was super-no pressure to decide on our order, took time to give us a little background on the family history-where the food originated from-absolutely top notch all the way. 
We visit Whittier several times a year, I'm 100% sure we won't be looking at any other places to dine!
